schema-create-subheader: A schema is like a template for credential that issuers and verifiers use. It includes specific credential attributes such as name, license number, issue date etc.

schema-form.name: Schema name
schema-form.name-explanation: The schema name is define your credential “type”. It is visible to everyone who views the credential.
schema-form.name-placeholder: ie. University degree, Drivers License, etc...
schema-form.description-explanation: Describe the schema's purpose. This is optional but recommended.
schema-form.attribute-explanation: Define the attributes you want on the credential.

schema-confirm-subtitle: Please review your schema before publishing. Once published, it cannot be edited. However, you will be able to duplicate the schema to make changes to a copy.
